intro: Cubeba albidopunctata, commonly known as white-spotted cubeba, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature, and the plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
